subject: Nutrition
title: How Excess Salt Damages the Body
description: Learn How Excess Salt Damages the Body in one minute.

hook.text: Americans eat 3,400 mg of sodium dailyâ€”nearly double the recommended limit for healthy adults.

buildup.text: Excess sodium forces kidneys to retain water, increasing blood volume and straining vessel walls.

discovery.text: Just 500 mg of extra sodium daily raises blood pressure measurably within a single week.

twist.text: Seventy percent of sodium comes from processed food, not the salt shaker on your table.

climax.text: Cutting sodium by 1,000 mg daily could prevent 100,000 deaths annually in the United States.

punchline.text: Most salt killing us is hidden in packaged food.
